text: A type is a set of values (e.g. integers, floaters, etc.) and a set of operations (e.g. +, -, *, /, etc.) on them.
Data types can be categorized as either primitive or reference.
The primitive types used in this course define the set of operations for numbers and boolean (true/false) values.

question.question: Which of these methods displays an input to the the computer monitor?
question.explanation: In java, System.out.print() or System.out.println() are the functions that print out inputs and values to the console/terminal.
